intro: Chrysocoma serrata, commonly known as the serrated chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shrubland or woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
